poem:
Title: "Sunday Snapshot"

A Sunday morning, awash in light,
Joanna Scanlan, in video delight.
Once two dogs, now only one;
Millie's journey in this world is done.

Levi, in need of hearty stride,
Forces Scanlan from her quiet hide.
Puppy Love - a memory seen,
In the color of a softened screen.

Tidiness a distant dream,
In Sunday's cadence, mildly serene.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Sunday with Joanna Scanlan: ‘Instead of tidying, I’ll watch videos about tidying’ Up early or lie-in? I’d love a lie-in, but I don’t get one because we have a dog. Until recently, we had two. Millie was in Puppy Love, the BBC sitcom Vicki Pepperdine and I did years ago. She sadly died a few weeks ago. Now I’m left with Levi, who needs an awful lot of exercise. Where are you dog walking? If". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Sunday with Joanna Scanlan: ‘Instead of tidying, I’ll watch videos about tidying’ Up early or lie-in? I’d love a lie-in, but I don’t get one because we have a dog. Until recently, we had two. Millie was in Puppy Love, the BBC sitcom Vicki Pepperdine and I did years ago. She sadly died a few weeks ago. Now I’m left with Levi, who needs an awful lot of exercise. Where are you dog walking? If
